intro: Lessingianthus semirii, commonly known as the Semirii sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers with a central disk, typical of the genus Lessingianthus. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
